repnme.cdata!: Hungary - Quick Start Gas Turbine Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project's outcome is highly
            satisfactory and sustainability is rated as highly likely.
            Bank performance at the lending stage was highly
            satisfactory and during supervision it was also
            satisfactory. Overall Borrower performance is rated as
            highly satisfactory. The project's success was due to
            the highly motivated commitment of the Hungarian Power
            Companies, which carried out much of the preparation before
            requesting Bank financing, to the use of a turnkey
            procurement contract for the main equipment, and to the
            absence of policy conditionality apart from standard
            financial covenants. The Bank was able to support the
            project under these conditions because of Hungary's
            demonstrated success in restructuring and privatizing the
            power sector, and in so doing, was particularly responsive
            to the client's expressed needs. Other lessons were
            that completing procurement prior to project effectiveness
            could greatly shorten the project implementation period; and
            that dealing with highly committed, competent, and
            experienced clients could greatly reduce costs to the Bank
            for project preparation and supervision.

docna.cdata!: Hungary - Quick Start Gas Turbine Project

display_title.display_title: Hungary - Quick Start Gas Turbine Project

repnme.cdata!: Hungary - Quick Start Gas Turbine Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Quick Start Gas
            Turbine Project is to provide about 200 Megawatt (MW) of
            generation reserve capacity to enable Hungary to maintain a
            level of reliability and security of supply in line with
            international standards.  The project consists of two
            complete single cycle gas turbine power plants rated at
            about 110 MW each, burning light distillate fuel oil.  The
            plants will consist of the following fully integrated
            components: 1) main equipment (gas turbine and generator
            sets and auxiliaries, air inlet, exhaust gas systems,
            including stacks, electrical equipment, power plant control
            system, high voltage switch gear and unit transformers,
            enclosures and light structure buildings); 2) auxiliary
            systems (fuel supply system, demineralized water supply,
            water supply for extinguishing system, fire detection and
            protection system, telecommunications and remote and
            indication systems); 3) civil works (site preparation,
            leveling, earthwork, foundations, roads and fences, site
            improvements, cable and piping channels and trenches); and
            4) network and infrastructure (telecommunications link).

docna.cdata!: Hungary - Quick Start Gas Turbine Project

repnme.cdata!:
Hungary - Quick Start Gas Turbine Power
            Plant Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment deals with
            the construction and maintenance of the Quick Start Gas
            Turbine Power Plant Project at two different locations,
            Liter and Sajoszoged, in Hungary.  The potential
            environmental impacts include: a) construction: noise and
            dust levels as well as construction wastes; b) air pollution
            and air quality: emission of dust, nitrous oxide and sulfur
            dioxide; c) soil quality: oil manipulation; d) surface and
            subsurface water quality: wastewater; and airborne
            admissions; e) handling and storage of raw materials and
            wastes; and f) noise emissions; and other impacts.  All of
            the impacts are negligible or within Hungarian standards.
            The impacts will be mitigated by the following measures: a)
            emission reduction through water ejection in the combustion
            chamber or by appropriate burner construction; b) collection
            and transportation of communal wastes, including separation
            of oily wastes; c) noise protection by silencers, special
            sound insulation and casing; d) accident prevention by
            infrastructure improvements; e) earthquake precautions; and
            f) fire protection and decontamination procedures.

docna.cdata!:
Hungary - Quick Start Gas Turbine Power
            Plant Project : environmental assessment

display_title.display_title:
Hungary - Quick Start Gas Turbine
            Power Plant Project : environmental assessment (Vol. 2)
